The Techno-Trance Half-Orc



Image source: https://ih1.redbubble.net/image.3206472 ... 5,f.u1.jpg

Details:
This is just a fun RP build with enough power to also be enjoyable to play as well.

Half-orc Bard with a Cha score of 6(8)
Multiclassed with Barbarian for some proficiencies and BAB 26+
RDD for extra power

The main features of the build are his or her bard song, and of course, his or her greataxe.

Melee base AB 43, Str 38, WF/EWF/IC Greataxe, Blind Fight, Knockdown / Improved Knockdown
HP 488, +14 AC from Tumble 40/RDD/Armor Skin, Epic Fort, Fort 30(38), Will 22(30), Reflex 18(26) - saves vs spells (+8 ) are in () brackets
Bard Song, Lingering Song, Skill Focus: Perform, Curse Song, ESF: Perform, Lasting Inspiration
257 skill points, no exp penalties, uncanny dodge, barbarian speed, some barbarian rages/day, ESF: Listen to help with detection (he or she is a musician afterall!)

Image source: https://i.redd.it/dnwu7nqb6cj21.jpg



Image Source: https://i.pinimg.com/564x/23/44/f8/2344 ... ea3612.jpg

The music style can be whatever you wish. 

I just chose Techno-Trance, but you could call him or her a Opera Singer Orc, Reggae & Rapping Half-Orc, The Sweet Orcish Lullaby, The Orcish Air-Guitarist, The Break-dancing Greataxe, or whatever tickles your fancy.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
For PvM, I would replace Disarm and Improved Disarm with Improved Knockdown and either Lingering Song or Skill Focus: Perform.  In epic levels, I would take Great Strength at level 27 in place of Toughness (or maybe replace Epic Fortitude instead) and also at level 33, moving Epic Skill Focus: Listen to level 40, replacing Epic Will.

I might be wrong, but I think it is traditional to list the classes in order in which they are first taken, making this build a Barbarian 4 / Bard 26 / RDD 10.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for taking the time to read through the draft and I didn't know about the standard format, thanks for educating me, I will re-write it once I edit the post.

I forgot about skill focus: perform :) Good suggestion. It would allow perform to hit 55 modified for an extra bard song lvl. As a strong musical performer he/she must do that. I will miss you my good friend Improved Disarm (but it is ambitious to fit it into a non-fighter/CoT build). Lingering song is good too. Takes a while before lasting inspiration.

Good suggestion to drop Epic Will and shift ESF: Listen to 40, I think I took it for the lols more than anything, but it is obtained so late it doesnt really matter 
I have decided to try to have a Str modifer which is even in my two handed builds, its just mildly more efficient (ie Str modified 1 = +1 dmg. Str modifier 2 = +3dmg)
I could make space for either Epic Prowess or Armor Skin. I like Armor Skin more because of all the AB buffs and AC lowering available in the build.

More HP + More AC = More Chop with Big Axe and More Singing Before Drink Health Potion

Edit: Edited most of Empyre65's suggestions into the main post. I dropped improved critical for a better bard song

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Quick update - playtested this character up to level 8, this is an extremely fun build.
Partied up with a tank, you can buff with song and UMD then smash em with the great axe.
Get a lucky crit and bosses fall rapidly.

Barbarian is clearly an extremely powerful early game class when stat caps are not able to be reached.
With rage and bard song at level 8, that's an instant +3 AB, +4 str and +4 damage / hit with a two-handed. 
Solo play is perfectly fine too, but party play is where the money is.

I thought I would attach a few screenshots of a brief party session I had with neon-maniac.



The half-orc in the centre is me, and the dex-based monk/fighter with expertise/improved expertise is neon.


Couldn't quite get the perfect screenshot because the encounter ended so quickly. 
I borrowed from Grizzled_Dwarflord's Muzzlemancer/Vicar of the Void concept, but instead I use UMD to 'self silence' myself, after I use Barbarian Rage, Bard Song, Invis Pot, Bull's Str Pot and Potion of Speed.
You can see the silence aura and its radius in the screenshot. Obviously GDL's build will have a much longer duration silence aura (the scroll is only 3 rounds, same as a wand)
Here I charge in to fight a difficult cleric boss for our level who can't cast any spells whilst that radius is active, and pretty much annhilate him with my greataxe before my monk teammate arrives.
I apologise that I didn't involve my monk teammate in the fight but things could have turned nasty if he did get a few spells off...


And here we are, sailing off to Greyhawk city, to sell a pile of loot gained on our adventures... happy days...


One final small comment - early game leveling should be:
Barbarian (4 levels) plus Bard level at either level 4 or 5.

Simply because this allows a skill dump into UMD to get it to 5, allowing more spellcasting / equipping items. 
As discussed rage x2/day + bard song is a great situational boost early on, when the cap cannot be reached easily, but rage will become less useful even detrimental mid to late epic. 

Anyway hope you enjoyed reading this post, thanks as always for suggestions

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: Just one question:  With 26 levels of Bard and the chance for undispellable buffs, to include Bulls, Endurance, Eagles, Mage Armor, Haste, Improved Invis and Keen Edge, why no investment in Charisma?  Did I miss a paragraph explaining that?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi GDL

You didn't miss a paragraph at all, and this is not a bad question at all. 

I simply chose to dump spellcasting with the original draft. 

From an RP point of view I just couldn't imagine a seductive and charming half-orc bard with a high Cha score plus spell casting on top of it. It was just too much for my brain. In the end I settled for a great very tanky half-orc warrior with an amazing song, UMD to cover some gaps and just dumped Cha to make this character a 3 stat dependant build (Str, Cons, Int), rather than a 4 stat dependant build (Str/Cons/Int/Cha) with two stats having penalties.

I believe if you want bardic spellcasting I think human is better which will do this better than a half-orc, including giving the Vicar of the Void a run for its money as a silence aura slayer :)

The build differs from yours in several aspects - uses CoT rather than RDD; is human; makes more use of Barb (essentially swapping Terrifying Rage for Lasting Inspiration) but still hits the Bard 16 sweet spot. posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Stag for posting
And any build you remember that makes a cognitive link with whatever you read is always of interest.
Reading through your build one thing that I have learnt very rapidly is that I have realised I have misread the requirements of terrifying rage and mighty rage
I can get away with Barb 15 for terrifying rage, and Barb 20 for mighty rage just as long as those feats are taken at epic levels and on a barbarian level up
It won't alter what I do with this build but for other barbarian builds drafts I make it certainly will.
Perhaps even a recent barbarian build draft I wrote I can drop some Barb levels for even more saves from CoT, maybe even drop some save feats for other stuff.

Thanks again
